s0102: Huan Zi said: 'By opening the people's hearts.'
s0103: Ping Gong said: 'How to open the people's hearts?'
s0104: Huan Zi said: 'If you are lenient, they will be lenient; if you are strict, they will be strict.'
s0105: Ping Gong's eleventh year, Chu attacked Qi again, reaching Jimo.
s0106: Tian Huan Zi defended against Chu, defeating them at Jimo, killing Chu general Tang Mei.
s0107: Ping Gong's fourteenth year, Huan Zi died, and his son Wen Zi Tao succeeded him.
s0109: Ping Gong's sixteenth year, Chu and Qin attacked Qi, reaching the Yellow River.
s0110: Tian Wen Zi defended against them, defeating Chu and Qin at the Yellow River, killing Chu general Tang Mei.
s0111: Ping Gong's eighteenth year, Wen Zi died, and his son Tai Gong Ying succeeded him.
s0113: Ping Gong's twenty-first year, Tai Gong died, and his son Hou Sheng succeeded him.
s0115: Ping Gong's twenty-fourth year, Hou Sheng died, and his son Dai succeeded him.

s0202: Zhuang Zi said: 'If you get the whole, you prosper completely; if you lose the whole, you perish completely.'
s0203: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully accept the command, please carefully do not depart from the front.'
s0204: Chunyu Kun said: 'Pig fat and thorn axles are made to be slippery, yet cannot pass through square holes.'
s0205: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully accept the command, please carefully serve the left and right.'
s0206: Chunyu Kun said: 'Bow glue and withered sinew are made to unite, yet cannot attach to large cracks.'
s0207: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully accept the command, please carefully attach myself to the ten thousand people.'
s0208: Chunyu Kun said: 'A fox fur coat, though worn out, cannot be patched with yellow dog skin.'
s0209: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully accept the command, please carefully select gentlemen, do not mix petty men among them.'
s0210: Chunyu Kun said: 'A large cart without linchpins cannot carry its normal load;
s0211: zither and se without linchpins cannot complete their five tones.'
s0212: Zou Ji Zi said: 'I respectfully accept the command, please carefully repair the laws and oversee corrupt officials.'
s0213: After Chunyu Kun finished speaking, he hurried out. Reaching the gate, he turned to his servant and said: 'This man - I spoke five subtle words to him, and he responded to me like an echo responds to sound. This man will surely be enfeoffed soon.'
s0214: After a year, he was enfeoffed at Xiapi below, titled Cheng Hou.
s0215: In Wei Wang's twenty-third year, he met with the king of Zhao at Ping Lu.
s0216: In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the king of Wei for a hunt at Jiao.
s0217: The king of Wei asked: 'Does your majesty also have treasures?'
s0219: The king of Liang said: 'Although my state is small, I still have pearls one inch in diameter that illuminate twelve chariots in front and behind, ten pairs. How can a state of ten thousand chariots have no treasures?'
s0220: Wei Wang said: 'My treasures are different from your majesty's.
s0221: I have a minister named Tan Zi who, when guarding the southern city, causes the Chu people not to dare invade east to take, and the twelve lords above the Si all come to court.
s0222: I have a minister named Zi who, when guarding Gaotang, causes the Zhao people not to dare fish east of the river.
s0223: I have an official named Qian Fu who, when guarding Xuzhou, causes the Yan people to sacrifice at the north gate, the Zhao people to sacrifice at the west gate, and those who move to follow him number over seven thousand families.
s0224: I have a minister named Zhong Shou who, when preparing against bandits, causes nothing to be picked up on the roads.
s0225: Using this to illuminate a thousand li - how is it only twelve chariots!'
s0226: The king of Liang was ashamed and displeased, leaving.
s0227: In the twenty-sixth year, Wei Hui Wang besieged Handan, and Zhao sought aid from Qi.
s0228: Qi Wei Wang summoned his ministers and consulted: 'Should we save Zhao or not save them?'
s0229: Zou Ji Zi said: 'Better not to save them.'
s0230: Duan Gan Peng said: 'Not saving would be unrighteous, and moreover disadvantageous.'
s0232: He replied: 'If Wei annexes Handan, what advantage is there for Qi?
s0233: Moreover, saving Zhao and stationing troops in their suburbs would mean Zhao is not destroyed and Wei is preserved.
s0234: Therefore it is better to attack Xiangling in the south to exhaust Wei, then when Handan falls, take advantage of Wei's exhaustion.'
s0236: Later, Cheng Hou Zou Ji was on bad terms with Tian Ji. Gong Sun Yue said to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not plan to attack Wei? Tian Ji will surely lead.
s0237: If we win the battle and gain merit, then your plan succeeds;
s0238: if we do not win the battle, either he dies first or flees later, and his fate is in your hands.'
s0239: Thus Cheng Hou spoke to Wei Wang, sending Tian Ji to attack Xiangling in the south.
s0240: In the tenth month, Handan fell, and Qi then raised troops to attack Wei, greatly defeating them at Guiling.
s0241: Thus Qi became strongest among the feudal lords, calling itself king to command the world.
s0242: In the thirty-third year, he killed his minister Mou Xin.
s0243: In the thirty-fifth year, Gong Sun Yue again said to Cheng Hou Ji: 'Why not have someone take ten pieces of gold to divine in the market, saying "I am Tian Ji's man.
s0244: I have fought three battles and won three times, my fame shakes the world.
s0245: If I want to do great things, will it be auspicious or inauspicious?"'
s0246: The diviner left, then he had people arrest the one who divined for him, verifying his words at the king's place.
s0247: Tian Ji heard of it and led his followers to attack Linzi by surprise, seeking Cheng Hou. He did not succeed and fled.
s0248: In the thirty-sixth year, Wei Wang died, and his son Xuan Wang Bi Qiang ascended the throne.
s0249: In Xuan Wang's first year, Qin employed Shang Yang.
s0250: Zhou sent Bo to Qin Xiao Gong.
s0251: In the second year, Wei attacked Zhao.
